molecule

Class QChemToMol

  • java.lang.Object
    • molecule.MolUtil
      • molecule.QChemToMol

  • public class QChemToMol
extends MolUtil
    Reads the output file of quantum chemistry program and set the data to electronic data in Moleclue.
    The "read" method reads only the results of electronic structure calculations (energy, gradient, etc.), and not the information of atoms (species, coordinates) by default. The exception is when the molecule is not set or when the existing molecule don't have any atomic data.
    Since:
    Sindo 3.6
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kiyoshi Yagi
    See Also:
    OutputReader

      • appendReader

      • check

        public void check()
           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                  OutputFileException
        Checks the Output file. --- Why not during the read process?
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - when the file doesn't exists
        OutputFileException - when the output contains error data

      • setCharge

        public void setCharge(int typeOfCharge)
        Set which type of atomic charge is read. The option is
        1. MoleculeReader.NoAtmCharge : Turn off reading atomic charge
        2. MoleculeReader.Mulliken : Mulliken charge
        3. MoleculeReader.ESP : Atomic charge from electrostatic potential
        4. MoleculeReader.NPA : Atomic charge from natrual population analysis
        Parameters:
        typeOfCharge - One of the above

      • setReadAtomicData

        public void setReadAtomicData(boolean readAtomicData)
        Force to read atomic data when true.
        Parameters:
        readAtomicData - the option to force read the atomic data

      • read

        public Molecule read()
        Reads the data of the output into Molecule. This method overwrites the existing electronic data. The atomic data is optionally read when (1) the molecule is unset, (2) the molecule doesn't have it, or (3) forced by option (readAtomicData).
        Returns:
        Molecule with data
